nodes.body: Generally these are rituals involving the confession, and thereby the expiation, of negative deeds. Some varieties of these rituals may be performed as ways of restoring broken vows. Some are directed at particular deities. In some cases, they are performed as a way of preventing negative consequences of particular infractions.
nodes.title: Description

nodes.body: bshags pa, bshags pa'i cho ga, so sor bshags pa, nyes bshags, bzod gsol
nodes.title: Related Terms

nodes.body: Lopez, Donald. "A Rite for Restoring the Bodhisattva and Tantric Vows." In Buddhism in Practice, edited by Donald Lopez, 503-512. Princeton: Princeton University Press, 1995.
nodes.title: Secondary Sources
